browser-action.name: type_username
browser-action.description:
Type some text inside an element.
Possible parameters are: - selector (required): The selector is a string that point to the elements in the page. Several types of selector are supported: text, CSS, XPath... You can specify several selectors by adding multiple "selector" parameters to this action. The targeted element will match any of the selectors (OR operator). - text (optional): Text to type - encryptedText (optional): Text to type on a password input. - timeout (optional): Forces the timeout for that action in ms. By default the OpenBrowser defaultTimeout is used. - mode (optional): TYPE or FILL. Type is more realist, types keys one by one. Fill sends the whole string in one go. Default to FILL. - delay (optional): Adds delay between each keydown/keyup sequence in ms. Used only when mode TYPE is selected. Default to 100 - frameIndex (optional): Frame index. Takes priority over frameName parameter. - frameName (optional): Frame name. - waitForNavigation.url (optional): URL pattern targeted, ex:http://tricentis.com/.* . The URL being navigated to must match this pattern. Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. - waitForNavigation.timeout (optional): Timeout in milliseconds. The navigation must occur within the specified timeout. Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. - waitForNavigation.until (optional): Allowed values are : LOAD, DOMCONTENTLOADED, NETWORKIDLE, COMMIT. The navigation will be considered done when the specified state is reached. Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed.
